result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephanie Kay Rhadans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay costs and DNA surcharge through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office within 60 days (9/16/16) unless a payment plan has been established.
Defendant shall undergo and follow through with any counseling as recommended by Agent.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephanie Kay Rhadans

16CM75, 16CM100 & 16CM177: Defendant Stephanie Kay Rhadans in court with attorney Becky N Van Dam.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Van Dam has 75 and 100 and Atty. Smith has 177; Atty. Smith's case to be D&RI; discussion held; victim rights complied with; Court reviews recomm.; Court reviews charge/penalties; Def. pleads Guilty to both counts in 16CM75; Court finds pleas made FV&I and finds Def. guilty of 16CM75 with 16CM100 and 16CM177 D&RI; State heard; Atty. Van Dam heard; Court imposes sentence

**W/H - 15 mo. PO
- $363 CC each count
- $200 DNA sample and surcharge each count
- counseling
- AODA & FT
- absolute sobriety, no bars
Return date on July 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

16CM75 & 16CM100: Defendant Stephanie Kay Rhadans in court with attorney Becky N Van Dam.  Robert Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Van Dam heard on status - has new case coming in for Intitial in a couple weeks (16CM177) and is waiting to be appointed on that case, wants another return date; Court removes JT and orders RD reset to 7/18/16 at 1:30pm
Jury trial on July 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Return date on June 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on May 2, 2016 at 09:00 am.

(2:32) Defendant Stephanie Kay Rhadans in court with attorney Becky N Van Dam.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. VanDam heard - recently appointed by SPD, Def. also has another pending case that she has not been appointed on yet (16CM100) and wants both to be resolved together; leave JT on; State requests that this case track with new case 16CM100; victim rights complied with; Court orders this JT will be removed and case to track w/16CM100 once it appears for Initial; bond cont.

Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

Defendant Stephanie Kay Rhadans appeared by video means w/Atty Greg Vollan - eligible for SPD. Prosecuting Atty James T. Sempf appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. Court enters Not Guilty plea. RD & JT set. Court sets $ bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.
